description: This schema represents a magnetometer measurement.

magnetic_field_strength_x.description: represents the magnetic field strength in roughly the direction of the north magnetic pole. A positive x-value means that part of the magnetic field is pointing north. A negative x-value means that part of the magnetic field is pointing south.

magnetic_field_strength_y.description: represents the magnetic field strength 90 degrees from the x-direction in the “magnetic east” direction. A positive y-value means that part of the magnetic field is pointing towards magnetic east. A negative y-value means that part of the magnetic field is pointing towards magnetic west.

magnetic_field_strength_z.description: represents the magnetic field strength in the local nadir direction (vertically down).

effective_time_frame.description: An accelerometer measurement should not be associated to a time interval. Hence, effective time frame is restricted to be a date time.
